III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Compliance with the child protection law
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214
Section • (1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
Description 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Parent notified her daughter's foster care worker that her daughter
was abused and neglected by her Foster Parents while in their
care; however, the foster care worker did not report the allegation
to MDHHS.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via video conferencing
on 10/17/2024. She stated she is the supervisor for Parent A and
Youth A’s case as well as the supervisor for the foster home
licensing workers. She stated she received an email from Parent
A on 9/30/24 that included concerns regarding Caregiver A &
Caregiver B. The foster home in which Caregiver A’s child, Youth
A, had previously been placed. After reading the email, she met
with her supervisor to briefly discuss what was reported in the
email. On 10/2/24, Foster Care Supervisor met with her supervisor
as well as the agency’s executive director to discuss the initiation
of a foster home licensing Special Evaluation. Foster Care
Supervisor reported initiating the special evaluation the following
day. Foster Care Supervisor stated she did not report the
allegations to MDHHS intake for investigation as there was
nothing within the email that made her suspect abuse or neglect;
rather, the concerns were related to potential foster home rule
violations. Foster Care Supervisor stated she has not reached out
to Parent A to schedule a meeting as she wanted to wait until this
interview to ensure she wasn’t impeding on the investigation. She
stated she would contact Parent A after the interview.
Parent A was interviewed by phone on 11/8/2024. She stated she
emailed Foster Care Supervisor and cc’d Foster Care Worker a
list of concerns she had related to the care of her child while in
foster care on 9/30/24. Foster Care Supervisor responded on the
following day asking if Parent A and Youth A could meet. Parent A
responded with her availability, but she did not hear back from
Foster Care Supervisor until 10/10/2024. Parent A stated Youth
A’s former probation officer told Parent A on 10/1/24 that Foster
Care Supervisor should have reported Parent A’s concerns to
2

MDHHS intake. Since Parent A had not received any confirmation
from Foster Care Supervisor that she had reported the concerns
to MDHHS intake or any other applicable department, she
reported the concerns she reported to Foster Care Supervisor as
well as additional concerns related to the food and a few other
things to MDHHS intake, DCWL, and the Foster Care Review
Board. She stated she has not heard back from anyone other than
DCWL regarding her allegations.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• 9/30/24 email from Parent A to Foster Care Worker and
Foster Care Supervisor stating Youth A shared concerning
things related to her prior foster home placement including:
1. Youth A and Caregiver A were in the garage and
Caregiver A asked Youth A to pinky promise to not
share a secret. That secret was Caregiver A stopped
using cocaine but planned to start using again once her
son turned 18 and that she knows how to pass a drug
test.
2. Youth A and other youths in the home got “pedophile
vibes” from Caregiver B.
3. One day, Caregiver B put his hands and arms around
Youth A, against a wall or couch. Youth A said she was
very uncomfortable with Caregiver A in her face,
hovering over her & preventing her from moving. He
eventually moved.
4. On several occasions, Caregiver B would stand in a
doorway sideways so Youth A would have to walk past
him closely to get by.
5. Caregiver A would sit at the table using his computer
and move the camera, so it was pointing away from
what he was doing.
6. Youth A watched every season of the show Shameless
while in the foster home, which is inappropriate.
7. Caregiver B yelled and screamed at Youth A for things
like not knowing where to put clean dishes.
8. Caregiver A acts differently when Foster Care Worker is
at the home.
9. Caregiver A told Youth A she wants to keep Youth A in
the home throughout high school, which Parent A
believed was so they would continue to receive checks
to support Caregiver A’s drug habit.
10. On two occasions, some of Youth A’s money was
missing when she returned to the foster home after a
3

visit and school. When Youth a told Caregiver A and
Caregiver B, they became upset and angry with Youth
A, accusing her of implying they took her money rather
than listening to her concerns
• 10/2/2024 Request for Foster Care Review Board Case
Review submitted by Parent A in which she alleged
Caregiver A and Caregiver B physically and emotionally
abused Youth A by refusing to allow Youth A to eat and
using food as punishment, physically pinning Youth A to the
couch, and using emotional abuse. Parent A included the
following details of the alleged abuse:
1. When Youth A was first placed in the home, Caregiver
A and Caregiver B would tell her when dinner was
ready. One day they stopped, and Youth A wasn’t
paying attention to the time and was denied food
because she went to the kitchen after the dinner time of
6 pm. This happened several times as the caregivers
would arbitrarily tell Youth A when dinner was ready or
not, so she didn’t know what to expect. There were
times when Youth A was eating dinner, Caregiver B
would tell her to eat more, commenting on her eating
habits. There were times when Youth A was denied a
snack even if she didn’t eat dinner.
2. Caregiver B put his hands and arms around Youth A,
holding her against the couch with his face hovering
over hers, preventing her from moving. As she was
about to tell him to move, he did.
3. Caregiver A taunted Youth A after she came to her with
a problem. Caregiver A also demeaned Youth A in front
of other people by saying Youth A’s hair always looks
greasy and other mean comments. Caregiver A told
Youth A what she thought and liked, disregarding Youth
A’s independent thoughts and interests which upset
Youth A.
• 10/2/2024 MDHHS Intake Notification in which the same
information documented on the Request for Foster Care
Review Board Case Review was provided by Parent A. It
was determined the allegations did not meet the criteria for
alleged abuse or neglect.
• 10/3/2024 online licensing complaint from Parent A alleging
she reported mistreatment of Youth A as outlined in the
4

document attached (the 10/2/2024 Request for Foster
Care Review Board Case Review) to Listening Ear Crisis
Center on 9/30/2024 after which they responded on
10/2/2024 asking if Parent A and Youth A would like to
meet. Parent A responded she did but has not since heard
back.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as, the email sent by Parent A
to Foster Care Supervisor did not include information that would
require Foster Care Supervisor to contact MDHHS.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
